Body: Are there language-independent aspects of the expression of emotion by intonation? More specifically, are there established relations between the expression of emotion by linguistic intonation and by musical means (i.e. musical intervals/phrases/melodies)? Quick summaries of what is known and/or pointers to the literature would be appreciated.
Title: What is known about the universal aspects of the relation between intonation and emotion?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I am a second-year PhD student in Linguistics at the University of Pennsylvania. My research interests lie in diachronic syntax, language as an evolutionary system, and quantitative methods in linguistic research.
